Hi Jessica,

We have made some changes on the publications. 

When the link below is clicked you should be redirected to the its pdf. This only applies on the publications with pdf links.
https://www.msaustralia.org.au/publication/ms-clinics-in-australia/

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Rica,

I have just spoken with a colleague and worked out that users are using the search bar and landing on these publications pages. E.g. if you type in "MS clinics" into the search bar the first result that turns up is that actual page.

I understand this request may be larger in scale and happy to chat to Heath about it - are we able to look at changing the search result of the publications like the example above where if clicking on the "MS Clinics in Australia" in the search bar you are actually taken straight to the pdf rather than this landing page?

Kind regards,

Jess

Here's one of the link:
https://www.msaustralia.org.au/publication/ms-clinics-in-australia/

Hi Jess, 

The "Publications" are not viewed as a single page as it is set as a 'downloadable' file on the site. Only the admins can access the "view" feature (the screenshot you provided).

You can check it on this link: https://www.msaustralia.org.au/publications/

@rica I think we don't need the single page for publications because user/visitor of the site has no access on that page, they will only see the publications archived, in this link https://www.msaustralia.org.au/publications/

maybe the client or the editor of the site is confused because they click the view. [screenshot]


but only the admin can see it, so we don't have to worry about layout because visitors/users of the website will not see it. let me know if my message is not clear 😅 thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Jaime Velasquez

full_threads.body:
Hi there,


I have just noticed when viewing the "post' version of our publications the following is appearing:



Is there anyway this can appear as the full size image? I understand not many people would be viewing like this but should they have the url it would be great if the full feature image could be shown.


Kind regards,
Jess
